data.text:
Roles turned down by Robert Redford:

At one time, both Robert Redford and Emma Thompson were to play the leads that Michael Douglas and Annette Bening eventually played. This is when the film was due to be a more political film.

Actor who got the part: Michael Douglas

Redford was considered for a role in the film - rumored to be either Willard or Kurtz.

According to Variety, Redford was at one time interested in this project.

Kubrick was told that in order to get funding from Warner's, he had to cast one of the "top 10" current actors. Ryan O'Neal, coming off the success of Love Story, was #2. Redford was #4. Kubrick wisely chose Redford, but Redford turned down the role in preference for George Roy Hill's unremarkable the Great Waldo Pepper. Ryan O'Neal did get the role of Barry Lyndon. Kubrick was reportedly pacing the set his first day on camera, saying, "OMG, he really can't act!"

Actor who got the part: Ryan O'Neal
